section.ja: 研究推進機構放射線研究センター

paper_title.en: EFFECT OF THE DIVERTOR LEG LENGTH ON THE POPULATION OF MOLECULAR IONS IN THE DIVERTOR SIMULATOR TPD-SheetIV
paper_title.ja: ダイバーター模擬装置TPD-SheetIVにおける分子イオン占有密度に及ぼすダイバーターレッグ長さの効果

description.en: In TPD-SheetIV, a simulation experiment on a long leg divertor configuration has been conducted and hydrogen molecular ion formation in detached plasma was observed. Improvements to the simulation geometry used in DEGAS 2 allowed us to study the effect of leg length on neutral transport. This paper also describes a simple ion balance equation and the ion density ratios obtained with it. From these data, it is shown that a long leg divertor enhances molecular ion density in the divertor, which might enhance molecular assisted recombination.

paper_title.en: A New Deduction Method of Heat Flux Evolution From Thermal Probe Data
paper_title.ja: サーマルプローブデータから熱流束変化の新しい評価法

description.en: Measurement and control of divertor heat flux are a crucial issue for realization of fusion burning plasma. However, time-dependent heat flux is often difficult to be estimated experimentally, because thermal diffusion process in thermal probe tips takes time longer than the discharge duration of present experiments. A new reconstruction method for time dependent heat flux from the measurement of the thermal probe tip temperature is proposed in this paper. The heat flux of the Large Helical Device divertor leg was analyzed by the proposed method as the function of the time for the first time. This indicates that heat flux measurement with thermal probes would become a monitoring tools even for the future fusion devices. ((c) 2014 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim)

paper_title.ja: バイオ燃料産業におけるフォルボールエステルのプラズマ分解に及ぼす活性ラジカル生成の影響
paper_title.en: The Effect of Active Radical Production on the Plasma Degradation of Phorbol Esters in Bio-diesel Fuel Industry
MEASUREMENT OF DIVERTOR HEAT FLUX AT THE END-CELL OF GAMMA 10
paper_title.ja: ガンマ10エンドセルにおけるダイバーター熱流束の測定

description.en: In GAMMA 10, divertor simulation study has been started as a new research plan. Finding of the reduction method of high heat-load to the divertor plates is an important key of an operation scenario of fusion reactors. So precise estimation of divertor heat flux is an important task to do it. The paper describes advanced concept of heat flux estimation and proposes the improvement of the sensor used in GAMMA 10. First experimental result of a new sensor is also shown.

paper_title.en: Optimization of the thermal shielding design of a temperature gradient type thermal probe
paper_title.ja: 温度勾配型サーマルプローブの熱遮蔽設計の最適化

description.en: In order to improve the temperature gradient type thermal probe (GTP) for low density plasma, simulation study with XOOPIC code was made. Considering the sheath stability condition found in 1D sheath study, simulation model for complicated 2D geometry was constructed and found it possible to increase the gap between the thermal shield and the probe tip. By using this result, a glass GTP was constructed. Unfavorable radial conductive heat transport was found to be reduced to negligible level and the effect radial convective heat transport was estimated. Plasma heat flux changes due to discharge change were monitored with this improved GTP. (C) 2012 Elsevier B. V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: DEGAS2コードを用いたV字ターゲット周りの中性粒子輸送シミュレーション
paper_title.en: Neutral particle transport simulation around the V-shaped target with DEGAS2 code
Application of a Temperature Gradient Type Thermal Probe to the Discharge Plasma
paper_title.ja: 温度勾配型サーマルプローブの放電プラズマへの適用

description.en: Thermal probes have been proposed to measure the plasma heat flux and to deduced the plasma parameters Their time response is, however, rather poor, due to the steady-state condition where they work. In this work, a new type thermal probe with three thermocouples is designed and tested for low density discharge plasma Monitering of heat flux changes due to discharge condition changes is successfully demonstrated The measurement limit and the error for this probe are also discussed (C) 2010 The Japan Society of Applied Physics

paper_title.ja: サーマルプローブを用いたヘリカル軸ヘリオトロンJ装置におけるダイバーター熱流束の計測
paper_title.en: Measurement of divertor heat flux in helical-axis Heliotron-J device using a thermal probe
EFFECT OF TARGET PLATE REFLECTION ON H-ALPHA SPECTRA IN THE DIVERTOR SIMULATOR MAP-II
paper_title.ja: ダイバーター模擬装置MAP-IIにおけるHアルファ線スペクトルに及ぼすターゲット板反射の効果

description.en: Neutral particle behavior and H alpha emission spectrum are simulated with Monte Carlo code DEGAS for divertor simulator Material and Plasma(MAP)-II. Effect of plasma condition( ie. detach and attach) on neutral particle transport and H alpha emission is studied. Target plate reflection is the main neutral source for MAP-II attached plasma. Change of projectiles and comparison with puffing source are also shown.

paper_title.ja: コンパクトヘリカルシステムで観測されたHアルファ線に対する3次元モンテカルロシミュレーション
paper_title.en: 3D Monte Carlo Simulation for H-Alpha Spectra Observed in Compact Helical System
Neutral particle behavior in divertor simulator MAP-II
paper_title.ja: ダイバーター模擬装置MAP-IIにおける中性粒子の挙動

description.en: Neutral particle behavior in the linear divertor simulator material and plasma(MAP-II) is studied with Monte Carlo simulation code DEGAS. Various model cases are simulated to compare the results with the attached and detached plasma condition. Neutral particle distribution depends upon the location of particle sources/sinks. H alpha spectra shape depends also upon plasma temperature and density and there exist a few dominant pathways to produce excited H atoms. (C) 2008 WILEY-VCH Verlay GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim.

paper_title.ja: 大気圧放電プラズマへのラングミュアプローブ法の適用
paper_title.en: Application of Langmuir probe method to the atmospheric pressure discharge plasma

paper_title.ja: ダイバーター模擬装置MAP-IIにおけるサーマルプローブ法を用いた熱流測定法の開発
paper_title.en: Development of Heat Flow Measurement using Thermal Probe Method in Divertor Simuletor MAP-II

description.ja: The method of measuring heat flow Q as a function of the sheath potential V is investigated in order to improve the time response of the thermal probe method. We found that the time constant τ for reaching a steady state in thermal phenomena was 123 ± 18 s. The result of τ indicated that the applicable method for measuring the Q-V characteristic was biasing the thermal probe in a stepwise manner, and this was verified experimentally. Although there existed a V-dependent offset of the Q-V curve deduced from the temperature gradients against that calculated from the ion current, a procedure to deduce the ion temperature T<sub>i</sub> is developed. The experimental error in T<sub>i</sub> was too large, and was caused by the error in Q. Thus we have to improve the accuracy of the Q measurement.
description.en: The method of measuring heat flow Q as a function of the sheath potential V is investigated in order to improve the time response of the thermal probe method. We found that the time constant τ for reaching a steady state in thermal phenomena was 123 ± 18 s. The result of τ indicated that the applicable method for measuring the Q-V characteristic was biasing the thermal probe in a stepwise manner, and this was verified experimentally. Although there existed a V-dependent offset of the Q-V curve deduced from the temperature gradients against that calculated from the ion current, a procedure to deduce the ion temperature T<sub>i</sub> is developed. The experimental error in T<sub>i</sub> was too large, and was caused by the error in Q. Thus we have to improve the accuracy of the Q measurement.

publisher.ja: The Japan Society of Plasma Science and Nuclear Fusion Research
publisher.en: The Japan Society of Plasma Science and Nuclear Fusion Research

paper_title.en: Effect of magnetic configuration on the neutral particle transport in compact helical system edge region

description.en: Neutral particle behavior in compact helical system (CHS) was studied with the Monte Carlo simulation code DEGAS. By shifting the magnetic axis position, magnetic configuration of CHS device changes from the material limiter to the magnetic divertor. We estimated Ha emission from excited hydrogen atoms and dissociated molecules with a collisional radiation model, and compared experimental observations to study the change of recycling condition. With the comparison of simulation result with Ha detector signal, the change of recycling source by the magnetic axis shift was qualitatively confirmed. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: コンパクトヘリカルシステム周辺領域における中性粒子輸送に対する磁場配位の影響

paper_title.en: Three-dimensional transport of neutral particles in the CHS edge region

description.en: We used Monte Carlo simulation code DEGAS and studied the neutral particle behavior in the Compact Helical System (CHS) three-dimensionally. In contrast to other helical devices, the CHS plasma in the standard configuration has contact with the inner vacuum vessel wall like the material limiter used in many Tokamaks and the neutral recycling becomes dominant there. As the intensity of neutral recycling changes also along toroidal direction, we extended our previous simulation model geometry three-dimensionally and compared the results of these models. We found the variation of the gap between the vacuum wall and main plasma enhanced toroidal transport of hydrogen molecules and atoms. As the formation of the edge transport barrier (EBT) discovered recently in CHS is characterized by a clear drop in H alpha emissions, it is interesting to study the relationship with the profile of atomic/molecular hydrogen and the H alpha emission profile. We estimated emission not only from excited hydrogen atoms but also from dissociated molecules with a collisional radiation model. We found that our H alpha detector signal in CHS mostly came from excited atoms and that the emission profile largely changed with the ETB formation.

paper_title.ja: CHS周辺領域の中性粒子の3次元輸送
サーマルプローブデータからのプラズマパラメーター決定法

paper_title.en: Determination of plasma parameters from thermal probe data

description.en: Thermal probe method uses heat flux data as the function of probe bias voltage. These data contain not only electron information but also ion one. In this paper, we applied a thermal probe to DC-glow discharge plasma and test it to deduce electron and ion temperature. Obtained temperatures are in qualitative agreement with theoretical prediction, but the accuracy of heat flux measurement must be largely improved. (C) 2006 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim.

paper_title.ja: プラズマ診断のためのサーマルプローブの設計

paper_title.en: Design of a thermal probe for the plasma diagnostics

description.en: When a solid material is inserted into plasma, it receives heat flux and electrical current according to its bias voltage. The heat flux-voltage characteristic is more complicated than the current-voltage characteristic and depend on ion temperature as well as electron temperature. Thermal probe method uses this characteristic to determine plasma parameter. We propose here to use it to deduce ion temperature and show the results on related work. (C) 2004 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim.

paper_title.ja: 低及び高電離状態のダイバーターへのバイアスの効果

paper_title.en: Effecting of biasing on divertors in low and high ionization states

paper_title.ja: ヘリカル系磁場の統計的解析

paper_title.en: statistical Analysis of the Helical Magnetic Fields

paper_title.ja: 磁気島周りの磁力線の統計的解析

paper_title.en: Statical Analysis of the Field Lines around the Magnetic Islands
Modeling of the mapping experiments based on the diffusion process

description.en: It is important in relation to the plasma confinement to understand the spatial variation of the impedance observed by the ''stellarator diode method''. We develop a numerical code based on the collisional diffusion model and apply it to the various experimental conditions. It is shown that the ripple diffusion of electrons plays an important role in determination of the impedance between a magnetic surface and the vacuum vessel wall. The effects of the electron temperature, neutral pressure, helical ripple, and the magnetic island are also examined.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.ja: 拡散過程に基づく磁気面マッピング実験のモデル化

paper_title.en: EDGE PLASMA PROPERTIES IN HELIOTRON-E

description.en: The magnetic limiter and helical divertor geometry predicted by vacuum magnetic field calculations has been confirmed by measurements with various probe and calorimeter arrays in Heliotron-E. The effect of modification of these configurations with auxiliary magnetic fields or a material limiter on the edge plasma profile is studied. The relation of the edge plasma properties with the main plasma parameters (density, heating power, etc.) are described. The amount of total heat loss to the divertor region is almost the same as that of the heating power. The edge plasma density is approximately proportional to the core plasma density.

paper_title.ja: ヘリオトロンEの周辺プラズマ特性
paper_title.en: Edge plasma properties in Heliotron-E

description.en: The magnetic limiter and helical divertor geometry predicted by vacuum magnetic field calculations has been confirmed by measurements with various probe and calorimeter arrays in Heliotron-E. The effect of modification of these configurations with auxiliary magnetic fields or a material limiter on the edge plasma profile is studied. The relation of the edge plasma properties with the main plasma parameters (density, heating power, etc.) are described. The amount of total heat loss to the divertor region is almost the same as that of the heating power. The edge plasma density is approximately proportional to the core plasma density.
